As Dave mentioned, it is a subject that can't simply be covered with a few =
brief answers. There are books and books of information on each of these to=
pics. However, you at least have a starting point. 

Regarding Confucius...=
 I think the most significant element of interest to you would be the influ=
ence of Neo-Confucianism on the development of "bushido-like" codes of beha=
vior during the Edo period. The combination of Shinto, Buddhism, and Neo-Co=
nfucianism led to a combination of beliefs and attitudes that were unique t=
o the samurai class during that time period. Loyalty and gi are two concept=
s that are deeply rooted in Confucian thought, for example.

I hope that he=
lps you somewhat. Good luck!

Jonathan P. Ellgen
